title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online first and then we did phone call/zoom interview. The interview was very straight forward with introductions and brief get to know you questions. They email and update you fairly rapidly as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself Why did you apply to BIDMC

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Pre screen call from HR rep. Interview with management and staff, including tour of work environment. Followed by a shadow day. It was average experience. Everyone was very warm and welcoming
Interview Questions: Goals in 5 years. Experience as gow it relates to the job.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is smooth and professional. One of the highlight during the process is that they require you to shadow a RN for a few hours on the floor before offering the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in cardiology department?

title: Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview first for about 15 minutes and then following that there was a 30 minute video call. The entire process was very quick and went very smooth.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit?

title: Admin Assistant Tier 2 Floater  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was a great process, easy yet thorough. The HR agent assigned to me gave me a lot of great insight into the job and matched my profile well with the job. In the job the interview allowed me to explain my past experience and even though it did not directly relate they let me explain the relation.
Interview Questions: How will your prior experience help in this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The process was very simple and easy, but there is a disconnect between HR and the labs themselves. Took a while to get an actual offer, but it was worth it.
Interview Questions: What is your plan the next few years?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: First round was a phone interview with the recruiter. Second round was a video call with four interviewer. After that, I had to work on a  dataset challenge within certain time.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Lab Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was ok with the hiring manager and new director. Received an offer with my desired salary. Then HR made a mistake and now offered a salary 15K less than the initial offer. I accepted the lower offer to learn new skills. Next day HR informed me that this position was no longer available. I would expect much higher from this institution. I have now steered many colleagues away from applying here. This HR "recruiter" should find a new career.
Interview Questions: What interests you in working in this department?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was casual and interviewer was very nice. It mainly consisted of general information about what the job would entail and general questions to me regarding my experiences and skillset.
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you want this job?

title: Legal Practice Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview was well organized, and no tricky questions. We went over my previous experience and skills. Also spoke about my education and career goals. Great staff and hiring process.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work here?

title: Line Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was fantastic, super supportive but there is a medical exam so just a heads up for that. It was a very long process so not for the faint of heart
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The whole interview process is simple and everyone I interacted with was very friendly.  The experience you have in other labs is an important topic to discuss, as well as how you would work as a team member.
Interview Questions: What analyzers have you worked with in the past?

title: Patient Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful interview process. Very helpful staff and hope to get hired and work within patient care for BI. The managers seem very flexible and understanding and they offer different salaries for depending on your shift.
Interview Questions: What can you add to our culture and environment

title: Clinical RA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the Clinical RA position at BIDMC Department of Anesthesia. First, the interviewer was late and they finally joined the zoom room, they said they were in a rush and only had 5 minutes to conduct the interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have any note-taking experience?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Had my first interview with HR, which was a very nice casual conversation focused on why I  wanted the position. Also discussed the overall logistics of the position. Heard back ASAP to schedule an interview with the nurse manager.
Interview Questions: What was a time you went above and beyond for someone?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: There was a short phone call with HR for an initial phone interview. Then I had a video interview with the nurse manager one on one.  I received an email from HR a few days later about getting accepted
Interview Questions: How did you handle a situation with a difficult patient

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on zoom , so a little awkward at first however brief and no technical questions by this specific hiring manager. Only a couple social questions. Phone interview was with a recruiter and standard nursing interview questions
Interview Questions: What was a time you went above and beyond for a patient?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from BIDMC after they had found my resume online. The two interviewers were pleasant, gave me a chance to answer questions completely and answered my questions without hesitation. I did not feel rushed or pressured.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about having to test on mice when needed for medical research? The interviewer noted that all mice testing is done humanely and adheres to strict industry regulations.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Not a typical formal interview. A friendly discussion. Technical as well as non-technical questions covered. Most importantly, they do not expect you to know everything but appreciate your enthusiasm to learn.
Interview Questions: How do I approach learning a new skill?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about a month. I applied online, and received an email about scheduling an HR phone screening about a week later. The phone screening took place a week after that initial email, and they just asked me to talk about myself and give an example of a time I went above and beyond and a time I made a mistake (only about a 15 minute phone call). I then scheduled an interview with the hiring manager for the next week, which was just a conversation about my resume. Then I scheduled an interview for the next week with my potential supervisor, where I asked some questions about the position. I then moved onto references, and received an offer within a few days.
Interview Questions:
Q: Tell me about yourself and why you applied for this position.
Q: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond.
Q: Tell me about a time when you made a mistake.
Q: How comfortable are you with asking for help?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Milton, MA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied one week and was emailed about an interview the next. I was able to set it up a few days later. They told me I would hear back the next week. Very quick process.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you succeeded and a time you failed.

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Great questions, very comfortable setting.     Highly engaged interview.     Really enjoyed the experience and felt valued.    I definitely want to work in such an environment.     Diversity and inclusion are highlighted.   Culture seems to be very positive
Interview Questions: What are your 5 year goals

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I received an email about an phone interview, which she just explained the job title, then they set me up for a zoom group interview, I hen you will move on to references
Interview Questions: Describe a time we’re you went above and beyond

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy going, average interview questions but need to prepare for them. Whole process took 2 weeks. You can tell they truly care about who they hire here. Very comfortable and positive experience.
Interview Questions:
Talk me through your resume?
Why are you interested in this area of nursing?
What was a time you dealt with a difficult patient?
How did you handle a time you disagreed with a coworker?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter that initially called for a screening was a bit rude and also had a simple misunderstanding that she didn't clear with me so I was left confused. Their pay is very low considering the job and COL in Boston. I had three zoom interviews for only 30 min long with the previous person in the role, director, and other heads. The interviews were disorganized, non-pointed, and very low effort & interest from their end compared to other longer, professional interviews I've had with other hospitals and research centers. I was purposefully asked a few trick questions which I thought was a sign of poor management and training for recruiting.  All of the interviews were also extremely fragmented and not one fluid line of questioning as my last interview barely had any questions prepared and barely got to know me.
Interview Questions: What is a weakness of yours?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Once you get to the interview, make sure that you know how to speak to your resume.  You will speak with the HR person and then the manager and, if lucky the folks you will be working with.  But nothing moves fast.
Interview Questions: Don't recall it was so long ago.  But I can say that it was conversational.  There is a template of questions.  Nothing surprising.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I was sent an email offering the opportunity for an interview. I was later phone screened for ~15minutes. This later followed up with a 30 minute phone interview. A week later, I had an in person interview!
Interview Questions:
What interested you in this position? 
Please tell me about your research experience.

title: Clinical Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was wonderful! I sent in my application materials, the hiring manager reached out to me within a week or two and then I spoke with three different people about the job (one of whom I was replacing as she planned to leave the position). After the very positive interviews, it took a few weeks to get everything squared away with HR. The whole process was fast and great!
Interview Questions:
Q: How do you keep organized?

Q: Sometimes patients are upset and you still have to work with them. How do you handle those situations?

Q: This is a part-time position, can you still live in Boston with a part-time position?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed for an interview, and the interview went well. Recruiter was really friendly throughout the interview. However, I didn't hear anything back though she said she'd contact back within the next few days. I even sent a follow-up email to which she replied that she'd let me know if she heard back, which I also never heard back from.
Interview Questions:
Q: How would others describe you
Q: Why Beth Israel?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of an interview one on one with the doctor in charge of the project and another interview with another doctor in charge of a similar project and the lab manager.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with coding and biomechanics testing?

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Was called for an HR interview. They asked me why I wanted to work there and to describe a time when I had to deal with a difficult patient. After that, I scheduled an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took a little over a week. I applied on a thursday, got an email for a phone interview the next day for the following monday, in-person Thursday, and an offer Friday. The in-person interview did not really feel like an interview, mainly just a tour, a couple of questions, and ID some petri dishes and microscope slides
Interview Questions: If someone else is having a bad day, how do you deal with that?

title: Proposals and Program Development Writer - Office of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Was reached out to by email and had a phone call. Interviewed in person, where I met three different people (was only expecting to meet one). People were friendly and likeable.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this job?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview, I felt like they did a great job of getting to know me. However, I do wish they did more to enlighten the current situation of their team.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Lab Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: There was one interview. It was really straightforward. I don't even think they asked STAR method questions. It was an entry level position, so they didn't seem to be very selective.
Interview Questions: What you want to do long term?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with three team members for 15 minutes each. Extremely thorough interview process. Asked many questions which required me to recall a difficult time, accomplishment etc. I was applying as a Co-op student
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness a former boss would say about you?

title: Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview - was definitely a courtesy call, every answer I gave was cut off and the interview was rushed through.  Got a declining email minutes after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why this position?

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I got the interview through an agency, I interviewed in Boston, the role was located in Woburn, MA. It was 20 minutes total and pleasant. I would have prefered they did a phone screen first as they are still looking for the right candidate for this role and it was tedious for them to bring me in for an interview (when I could have done a phone screen on a lunch hour)
Interview Questions: How strong are you with Excel

title: Surgical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: 2 phone calls with a manager & supervisor. 1 in person interview with management & current department employees. The entire group was friendly and follow-up with a tour of the department.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Virology and Vaccine Research Department about a year ago. The process took about two weeks, however, there were several red flags that made me withdraw my application. The interview was scheduled at 1:00 PM. I got there at 12:55 PM, and the hiring manager did not show up until 1:45 PM!! And when she finally showed up, she was a bit rude and acted like the situation was normal because she is usually "busy". She also mentioned that the job description was changed and was not really clear about the responsibilities of the position or the qualifications that they were looking for! After a few days, I received an email from the front desk saying that the hiring manager does not feel like I am a good fit for the position, however, I was somehow invited to the second interview to meet rest of the team. I withdraw my application.
Interview Questions: Why do you think we should hire you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: There was an in person interview that required meeting with three different people, the research coordinator, the PI and an office administrator. The questions were not terribly difficult and the whole process was relatively simple. There was supposed to be a second round of interviews just to meet a different PI but with scheduling difficulties and vacations, this was cancelled.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past research experience.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds-- first with the program manager, second with a selection of MD's that I would be working with. The program manager wanted to see how you would do in a high stress environemnt. The MD's were most interested in your qualifications i.e. research background, ability to understand and follow protoocl specifics.
Interview Questions: Are you organized? Attention to detail? Goal oriented? Can you handle inter-personal conflict? Can you handle a high stress environment?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: First an email, then phone interview, follow ups over the phone and email, and finally submit references. No in person interview in my case. I thought the HR team was very approachable and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go into nursing?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, I work for a lab so the interview was very specific to that lab. Not many questions about the hospital or anything other than the research being done in the lab.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about your previous research.

title: Clinical Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: My position called for 4 different interview. Two with the supervisors of the service, 1 with the MD of the service and one with the other coordinators in the department. They also asked similar questions but from different perspectives. The goal is really to get to know who you are and what you bring to the department,
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What experience do you have in research?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: They required you to provide at least five references who were emailed a survey to fill out. The interview was a semi-group interview and lasted two hours. This was a pretty laid back interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you needed to ask for help.

title: APRN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and had a phone interview with HR, following the phone interview I received invitation for in person interview which was the following week. It lasted an hour was an overall positive experience.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time in which you took a clinical risk?

title: Administration Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very laidback. It felt more conversational than answer and question interview style.  Although the manager was unable to provide/ explain the day to day roles or expectations of the job very well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Needham, MA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with an HR rep for a 30 minute  interview. She was very pleasant, professional and laid back. She made me feel at ease and was very polite.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about an experience you had that has made a difference in your career.

title: Research Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process has been fairly laid back.  They want to know about your past skill, and how you can put those skill to work in your new position.  They offer an overview of the role they are trying to fill.  They really seem to want to see if your skills fit, but also if your personality will be a good fit for their lab.  Team work is emphasized.
Interview Questions: What are some of your major responsibilities at your current job

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Was asked questions by HR and the floor manager. Very straight forward. Took a tour of the floor with the floor manager and was introduced to many of the RNs and PCTs.
Interview Questions:
What would you do if there was an emergency?
Are you able to lift 25 pounds?
What would you do incase a patient becomes agitated and aggressive towards you?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with two directors at their office for a 45 minute conversation.  Mostly it was a review of my resume and experience.  Very conversational yet to the point. Started and ended on time.  Then there was a 15 minute meeting with HR, who gave an overview of the process.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary, just follow up on resume and qualifications.  No tricks or surprises!

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviewers asked the basic interview questions as well as a few scenario questions. The atmosphere was friendly and relaxed. I went on a tour of the unit afterwards, which was nice. It took over a month to hear back.
Interview Questions: They asked for my biggest strengths and weaknesses.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: First I interviewed with the Director of the unit. We went through my resume. Then I interviewed with the lead Administrative Assistant and had a tour of the office.
Interview Questions: If you could have any superpower, what would it be?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: real informal interview, more like a conversation, just told them my background and experience, and we had a good back and forth so I know the interviewer liked me. as long as you seem to have a good comprehension of the role and the ability to express yourself in a professional manner you'll be OK
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
After applying for the role, I was contacted by a Beth Israel HR employee/recruiter for a phone interview. The call was pleasant, filled with questions fleshing out my prior experiences and the recruiter talking about the role and the department it supported. Upon conclusion of the interview, I was told the next step was an in-person interview.

I touched base with the recruiter a few days after the phone screener to see how things were progressing and was told she was still trying to set up the interview(s). A few more weeks went by with no word from the recruiter and I reached out to see if I remained in contention for the role. The recruiter never responded.

Stated simply, the above conduct is unprofessional. If the recruiter hadn’t made any mention of next steps or added a qualifier (i.e. “If you make it to the next stage here’s what will happen…”) I would have been disappointed in not being further considered but would have understood. But to be told an interview with BI Medical Center staff was next and then never hear anything again?  Wow. Fantastic human resources skills you have there…
Interview Questions: What interests you about this role?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position and despite being a very strong candidate, it took over a month for them to call me. At that point, I had an offer from another company and the BIDMC recruiter was so rude on the phone that I actually turned down the interview. The HR rep invited me to ask questions, but couldn't answer any of the questions I asked; he was snide and dismissive when I asked questions about the department and culture.  A colleague of mine did interview, only to have problems with the same recruiter.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in a position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: First they scheduled a screening phone interview conducted by HR.  A couple days later she contacted me to set up an in person/Skype interview. I was able to travel for an in person interview, but she did state that a Skype interview would not negatively impact my chances.
Interview Questions: What kind of experiences are you looking to get out of this job?

title: Business Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Overall, this was a great interview experience! Initial outreach was done via HR and then coordinated with the hiring manager a team. I was able to meet with the entire team that I would be working with and supervising which provided a great realistic view as to the every day duties! Individuals were opens d honest about the challenges and areas for improvement as well as speaking about all of the positive areas of the department. Overall, you could feel the great culture here and how everyone truly embodies this!
Interview Questions: Please provide an example of a previous situation where you had to coach an employee verses discipline.

title: Data Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Went through all of the interview processes (personality quiz, HR phone screening, 1:1 w/ hiring manager, and power point presentation) through reference checking.  Received plenty of compliments and positive feedback from other senior directors and hiring manager afterward.  The team continued to sell me the job.  The hiring director even emailed me herself to tell me I did a good job on the presentation.  HR was excited and hinted a potential offer was coming later in the week and voluntarily told me all about the hiring processes and start date, etc.   He explained that their hospital hiring process is different as in they do reference checks first before extending an offer whereas most hospitals reference checks are practical an offer.  My references diligently completed the skill survey throughout the week.  The recruiter insisted on scheduling a time later in the week to discuss a potential offer, but on that day all I received was a canned email stating they had moved forward with another candidate.  I'm certain this was about salary.  They coaxed me into revealing how much I was making by stating how there's the potential to be higher than the range they provided.  Since they're checking my reference, I caved and revealed my salary requirement, but reassured I was open to negotiating and they picked someone else.   Bully with a smile and passive aggressive snakes from hiring manager to HR.  Don't trust them! Leadership didn't even have the decency or courage to negotiate.  Worst interviewing process in all of the Boston hospitals I've been with!

In reflecting back, it was sketchy interviewing and HR practices.  The org leaders expect candidates to share their best ideas so it can be capitalized (free consulting!) and then hire someone with less money.

BEWARE:
- Watch out for sneaky, fake, and disingenuous culture at BIDMC.  For the department's scope of work, it is a tragedy their leadership behaves like this which explains why they're only a three star hospital
-Don't believe in anything they promise you about being fair and equitable and how they're willing to pay for competitive talent - they are CHEAP.   They will choose the next candidate over you over petty cash.
-Cheap talk about how desirable and competitive their position and pay is.  Hint:  most managers don't need to boast about it if it's true
-HR is demanding completely disrespect candidate's time, priorities, and treat people like a number even their patients said so
Interview Questions: Have you thought about salary?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by HR to set up a date and time, then I went to an in-person interview at BIDMC, they said they would contact me in 2 week regarding a 2nd interview.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Process was pretty straightforward. Got an email after applying online, and was asked to come in for interview. I met with various team members. After the interview, I was asked to provide my references, but I never heard back following that.
Interview Questions: Can you give an example of a time you dealt with conflict or criticism?

title: Digital Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was pretty standard to start: 1 call with HR, a personality test, then 3 separate in-persons with members of the team. This took about a month. Shortly after the last in-person I was asked for references. I then submitted SIX. A week went by and I heard nothing. I followed up with the HR rep, who had no updates. Repeat x4 and we're a month out from the reference checks. I finally got a call from HR saying that they're moving on with other candidates who have more experience. In what world does an employer check SIX references after 3 interviews and then up and decides that the candidate does not have enough experience? Shouldn't that be determined after the interviews but PRIOR to asking a candidate for references?  Further, the HR rep tried really hard to sound empathetic but instead came across as condescending and patronizing. I see an older review that also mentioned a similar experience so this is obviously not a one-off.
Interview Questions: What made you decide to apply for this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I met with HR for a few minutes to discuss the process that could occur after the interview and then met with the manager for an interview- she was not welcoming
Interview Questions: What do you know about this unit

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and also sent CV, cover letter to the PI. Was reached out by HR, everything went well, overall question about goal and background. Had a meeting with PI and other lab memebers
Interview Questions: Much about what you have been doing

title: Medical Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: One of my best job interviews. the questions were straight forward and right to the point. very creative and welcoming directors . i am very proud and honored to join BIDMC .
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied as a new grad NP with 10 years RN experience in the same field of the position. I applied online and got a call from the manager for a phone screening. About one week later had a meeting with HR to explain benefits and hiring process and 1:1 interview with department manager. Then a week after that, a 5 hour shadowing experience with NPs. The whole process was not difficult, but it did take some time - about 2 months total from application to offer.
Interview Questions: Explain your professional background/experience and why you want to be a NP.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I was screening by HR over phone and in person and then I met with 3 supervisors. I had to submit references and once they were approved, I was hired. Salary was negotiated
Interview Questions: Past work experience

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed to set up a phone interview with one of the HR representatives, which took about 15 minutes. Then, I was invited to interview in person with the director. It was a straightforward interview, she asked about my current job and experience and told me about the position. It was about a half hour long and I felt comfortable.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging situation that you've dealt with at your current job.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Directions to interview site were clear and accurate.  (The HR department is off-site.)  Interviewer was personable and asked questions appropriate to the position.  Benefits information was provided to me at the interview.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a difficult phone call from a provider seeking information?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: it was easy. place was easy to find she made me comfortable, typical interview questions. it was a casual per diem so no set hrs.  they needed someone that was just on call when someone called out or wanted their shift covered the per-diem was there to cover it
Interview Questions: are you punctual?

title: Gift Shop Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very casual and they hire a lot of work-study students from the neighboring colleges and surrounding area. The manager is incredibly kind and accommodating. She is just getting a gist and understanding of your personality and work ethic.
Interview Questions: Have you worked in customer service before?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was called initially by the HR rep and was asked some behavioral type of questions and once she was satisfied she scheduled a face to face interview with a junior investigator.  The interview process was fairly easy and straight forward. The investigator asked for my references the same day. 
However, the reference site BIDMC uses is like an online survey. By this point, my references had already been contacted a couple of times and I was already being considered at another hospital, so they did not reply to the survey email on time.
Interview Questions: What are the major steps to a Western Blot

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone call where I was asked to come in for a day which included 5 hours of shadowing and three interviews. The interviews were with the NP manager, chief of neurosurgery, and HR rep.
Interview Questions: What are three words your references would use to describe you.

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: First, you interview with group manager. This is for about 30 minutes, Afterwards you interview with a few other of the higher up team members. additionally, you Also get opportunity to meet with your (hopefully) future coworkers. Overall a pretty standard interview process
Interview Questions: Example of being attentive to detail

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviewers, the clinical research administrator and the statistician of the group. They interviewed me at the same time and process took about an hour. They asked the usual questions.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself 2-3 years from now?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed to go in for an interview within a week or two after I had applied. I met with practice coordinator, manager and chief of the department. I spent a total of an hour and a half interviewing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you made a mistake and what did you do to fix it?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted online application
They contacted me via email after 3 weeks
phone interview for 20 mins
PI sent me his ongoing work and ask me to present it on the interview day
in person interview 
post interview follow up 2 weeks after interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Cst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very informative and in depth phone conversation. Described working conditions, job details, further expectations; along with city description, parking, and what to fully expect. Also let me know upfront that it was the night shift that needed coverage and asked if that would be okay by me to accept.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working nights?

title: Senior Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Sent application via online application and a week later was sent an online "personality test" to see if I was a fit for the job.  A week later was asked to set up an interview with HR which was more about going over details of the job to see if there are any dealbreakers.  10 days later received an email about an interview date with manager.
Interview Questions: How much I expected to be paid?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, had a phone interview about a week later, then a 2 hour in person interview with HR and 3 people within the department. I was told I would hear back within the week if I would come back for a final interview. Two and a half months later I got an email about getting 5 references together, so I was pretty confused. I emailed them back and it was an "IT issue" and the email was supposed to be telling me that the position was filled.
Interview Questions: Why do you think that you'd be good for this position?

title: Summer Health Corp Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Tough. 120 people for 20 spots. They were very nice people and very helpful. They asked alot of question.  I thought I had a good chance since I prepared for the interview, and I ended up getting accepted. It was very competitive.
Interview Questions: When does the program start and end

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: 30 years ago- Sent in resume and application by mail to HR. HR called to set up interview.1:1 interview with unit manager. HR called a couple of days later with job offer.
Interview Questions:
Previous experience
Why BI?

title: Bio-Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted by department's project manager after a week to set up a 20-30 phone interview for later that week. Actual phone interview lasted less than 10 minutes. Basic screening questions: tell me about yourself, how well do you know this program, and any questions for her to answer. It felt very rushed and I didn't get a good feeling from it. Next step would've been an in-person with the department director but never heard back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied at the end of the year and received a notice for interview two weeks after. I scheduled the interview in late January and got accepted a few days after.

title: SPD Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: very formal interview process. nothing out of the ordinary. everyone was friendly and welcoming. Not a very long process either. definitely would recommend this hospital for employment if you're looking
Interview Questions: they asked me about work experience

title: Medical Physicist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was 25 minutes late for phone interview.  Was not at desk for expected interview, and I had to call HR office to track them down. Spoke to them for five minutes and was told I was unqualified.  It was an unfavorable  inconsiderate waste of time.
Interview Questions: What type of institution did you work? Was it large or small and what was the patient load?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back within a week- week and a half. Then had a short phone interview with HR and they wanted to set up an in person meeting with the nursing director. Went in for an interview and heard back a week later. Very relaxing and everyone was very delightful and nice to talk to. I immediately felt comfortable there

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Medical Center. initial interview was phone interview with HR person( She was super friendly and pleasant).  Then the following week, I interviewed with the Director and another interview on the third week with three different MDs which took a whole day. 
Interview was based on background, availability and management style .Very straight forward.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? 
How do you handling conflict?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied on 10/15/16 and heard back 3 weeks later on 11/04/16. I first had a phone call with the Program Administrator of the lab, who told me more about the position and asked basic behavioral questions. A few days later I had a Skype interview with the PI I would be working with. Finally, I was called in 11/11/16 to meet with 4 members of the lab (Research Assistant, different PI, Research Nurse, and Administrative Director). All my interviews were very casual and relaxed. I was mostly asked about my previous research experiences, how long I would stay with the group, and my future plans. Very easy.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to work as a team.

title: Medical Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very long, arduous process. Step 1: Phone interview with HR person. Step 2: Interview with 4 different people spread out over multiple days (created problems at my current job). Took over 2 months from when I submitted my application to receiving an offer.
Interview Questions: Can you commit to this job for at least 2 years?

title: Tech Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job about 6 weeks ago. I got an email for a recruiter to set up a phone interview time. The phone interview was quick and easy , pretty straight forward.  Afterwards scheduled an interview with the hiring manager. Overall it was a decent interview not too hard. Afterwards,I got a call from the hiring manager to set up another interview with the team I would be working with. She asked me to reschedule once ( even asked me to take a half a day off at my other job to accomdate their staff, like really?)  Again was pretty straightforward interview overall I would say it was a decent interview.  The staff seemed friendly. But afterwards I met with the manager asked few questions about policies,etc... She talked a little about potential salary,which didn't seemed too bad( but currently I make the same amount doing less work )   but didn't seem like too much for negotiating higher. The staff seem fine, but the whole conversation about salary with the manager turned me off. Something about the manager gave me a weird negative vibe ,( my gut is always right)The job would be a good learning experience , but I still want to be paid a decent salary, especially with the type of commitment I would have to make.
Interview Questions: What are your goals for the future?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted about a week later for a phone interview. Phone interview was 20 minutes, spoke with the doctor whose lab I would be working in. It was fairly quick and easy. Just was asked about the research project listed on my resume, for a set of references, and about my goals for the future. Also was asked about if I lived in the area and if it was easy for me to commute in or not.
Interview Questions: What are your goals for the future?

title: Accountant Interview

title: RN Interview

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview

title: Executive Assistant Board Liaison Interview

She said her connectivity was not good and asked me to review my resume over the phone, the highpoints.  I tried to do this, but felt she wasn't listening at all. She repeated questions and asked me to repeat my questions.  I asked 5 and she couldn't answer any.  Never heard back. Nothing. I sent an email, no response.

title: Pulmonary Function Tech Interview

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received an email a month later to schedule a phone interview. I had phone interview that same week and was later scheduled for an in person interview, which took place two weeks later. I was told I was meeting with three people but out at the interview, I was only meeting with one (meeting with other two was only for people moving to the next round). Manager only asked me four questions, described the position and once he was done, told me what the next step would be and didn't give me any opportunity to ask questions!

I did not get his card, so that I could send him a thank you email (my fault). I reached out to the recruiter I initially interviewed with, in order to see if I could get his email but she didn't even bother responding back. I did feel that was very rude and unprofessional. Even if not interested in me as a candidate, don't just ignore my email, especially when I am only trying to thank the interviewer. If it couldn't be given out, a simple response informing me of this would have been fine or just letting me know you would pass on the message would have been nice. I don't think it is right to just ignore the email.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, HR contacted me through email a week later to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview consisted of 15 or so questions that asked about my work and clinical experiences. After the interview I was scheduled for an in person interview with the nurse manager of the unit. The in person interview consisted of questions, a tour of the unit and a detailed explanation of the job, lasted a little over an hour. A week and a half after my interview HR called back and offered me the job.
Interview Questions: Goals for the next 5-10 years, Time where I worked as a team and it went well, a patient experience where I made a difference.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Boston, MA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
2/25/15: Applied + filled out personality quiz/questionaire
2/26/15: HR Email for Phone Interview with HR Rep
2/27/15: Phone Interview with HR Rep + E-Mail following up with date/time to interview with the Department
3/3/15: First interview w/ director of clinical operations & Practice Administrator + Was given a quick tour of the department + was sent e-mail from HR asking for references

3/13/15: 2nd interviews with other 3 admins & Doctor I would work with primarily (these were formalities) & the Chief Financial Officer (last screening to make sure I wasn't a psychopath?)
3/18/17: Received verbal offer from HR

Cons: HR did not negotiate salary, unfortunately had to take offer that was $5K below market value for the position
Interview Questions: Asked about prior work experiences and how they would relate to this position. Asked some behavioral/situational questions about working with high strung, anxious patients and how I would handle dealing with difficult/upset patients. Asked questions about team work and whether I had issues with coworkers in the past. Asked about my ability to learn new software/technology. Are you a fast learner? What do you know about the department (GOOGLE THE DEPARTMENT BEFORE YOU INTERVIEW so you can impress them with knowledge of what the department does and such). Asked about education, future goals, and whether I could commit to the position for 2-3 years. What are your strengths + what are your weaknesses?

When she explained the job to me it was far more interesting to me than how the recruiter described.   Than I met with my office mate and counterpart to the position.   Also incredibly nice! title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center (Brookline, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an online application and was immediately sent back an email to fill out a questionnaire assessment that took about 15-20 min to fill out. Once that was submitted I was contacted by HR after 3 days to set up a phone interview. The phone interview took about 10 min and was a very basic interview, no hard questions, essentially just fact checking, and at that point we set up an in-person interview with the office manager. The in-person interview consisted of the office manager and the lead medical assistant, they asked standard questions while looking at my resume. After the interview they showed me around the office to get an idea of the work environment. Two days after the in-person interview I was contacted again by HR to submit 5 references on an online form and to sign and fax a form in. Unfortunately, a little after a week I was emailed again informing me that they decided to move forward with another candidate.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you, as a new graduate, versus someone with experience? What will you bring to the team?
